{{primarysources|date=March 2011}}
'''Grego Anderson''' (born 1968) is an [[United States|American]] [[blues]] [[musician]] and folk artist, living in [[Austin, Texas|Austin]], [[Texas]].

==Art==
His [[work of art|artwork]] has been exhibited in galleries from [[Boston, Massachusetts|Boston]], [[Massachusetts]] to [[San Diego, California|San Diego]], [[California]], and is featured in the Mojohand online gallery.<ref>[http://www.mojohand.com Mojohand online gallery]</ref> His work is best described as "rustic;" he paints only portraits of blues musicians on wooden planks.

==Honors==
Anderson was recognized by the [[United States Congress]] in 2003 as one of two official visual artists for the Year of the Blues.<ref>[http://www.yearoftheblues.org/features.asp?id={F0D4E05A-06A8-45CC-B570-D2F9216C9CBB}&type=GallerySub Year of the Blues]</ref>

==Appearances==
Anderson appears in the [[Lightnin' Hopkins]]' [[documentary film]], ''Where Lightnin' Strikes—the Lightnin’ Hopkins story'',<ref>[http://www.wherelightninstrikes.com ''Where Lightnin’ Strikes—the Lightnin’ Hopkins story'']</ref> and on the Veria [[television program]], ''The Art of Living.''

==Music==
Anderson is also a blues musician, playing [[lap steel guitar]] with The Freight Train Troubadours and Los Pistoles in Austin Texas, and as a [[sideman]] throughout the [[Americas]].
